p: Gender plays a role in climate change mortality. Men are exposed to more outdoor activities and work in conditions above 27 °C than women (56% of male workers men compared to 46% of female workers) [ 86] and men more frequently (age 15–64 years old) participate in more strenuous outdoor activities [ 87]. Despite this, the relationship between gender and heat-related mortality varies by cause of death and region [ 72]. Some studies have not found any gender differences, while others have found that the effect of heat mortality was greater for females.
